itineraryStepDescription: The Porto Alegre Public Market, in downtown Porto Alegre, Brazil,
is the city's oldest public market. It also is an important historic
landmark and a well known meeting point, with many coffee shops and

itineraryStepInstruction.1: Walk to Borges de Medeiros Avenue.
itineraryStepInstruction.2: Turn right on 7 de Setembro Street.
itineraryStepInstruction.3: Turn left on General Câmara Street.
itineraryStepInstruction.4: Go ahead until Marechal Deodoro Park.

itineraryStepDescription: The São Pedro Theatre (Theatro São Pedro in Portuguese) is the oldest

Sul, Brazil. Founded in 1858, it quickly became an artistic, social, and

itineraryStepInstruction.1: Go in direction to General Câmara Street and turn left.
itineraryStepInstruction.3: Turn right on General Bento Martins Street.
itineraryStepInstruction.4: Turn left on Maua Avenue and go ahead.

itineraryStepDescription: The Usina do Gasômetro is where an old electric industry on the shores
